problem_text: Two projectiles A and B are launched with speed \(v_0\). A is launched at angle \(\theta\), B at \(90^\circ - \theta\). Show that their ranges are equal and find when their maximum heights are equal.
diagram_request: Two complementary trajectories (θ and 90°−θ) showing equal range and different heights.
solution_steps: Compute R_A and R_B using sin(2θ) identity.
Heights equal only if sin^2θ = cos^2θ → θ=45°.
common_mistakes: Assuming complementary angles give equal heights
